narrative.title: Catanzaro Division - 1940Q4
narrative.situation: Italian infantry_autotrasportabile deployed in North Africa during 1940Q4.
narrative.objectives: Infantry division for static defense of Buqbuq sector guarding Sidi Barrani coastal approaches October-December 1940. Autotrasportabile classification meant truck-transportable but division lacked adequate operational vehicles (only 33% by Q4). Green division unsuited for mobile operations, assigned to fortified defensive positions.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

weather.terrain: Coastal plain with rocky desert inland (Buqbuq sector Egypt, then Bardia Libya)

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Standard Italian infantry division structure (two regiments)
Full complement of support weapons (when operational)
Larger personnel strength than colonial/CCNN divisions (10,500 men)
Some combat experience gained in static defense Q4 (vs completely green in Q3)

environment.terrain_type: Coastal plain with rocky desert inland (Buqbuq sector Egypt, then Bardia Libya)
